info.name: Network Architecture and Security
info.main: Let's look a bit beyond the obvious in terms of networks, delving into these topics will help you become a more competent professional
info.results: Congratulations! Now the world will be a little safer thanks to you...

questions.q: What is a network architecture and why is it important for a company?

a.option: A set of tools for network management.
A structured framework for the design, implementation, and management of a network.
A type of software for network security.
A physical device that enables internet connection.

questions.q: What are some key elements that typically form part of a network architecture?

a.option: Network topology, network components, network protocols.
Servers, firewalls, routers, switches.
Users, applications, data.
All of the above.

questions.q: What steps should be followed to design and implement a network architecture in a company?

a.option: Define the topology, choose the components, configure the devices.
Identify the requirements, select the topology, plan the security.
Install the wiring, connect the devices, test the network.
Train the staff, document the architecture, perform maintenance.

questions.q: Why is documentation important in a network architecture?

a.option: To facilitate network management and support.
To comply with security standards and regulations.
To save costs in network implementation.
To have a historical record of the network's evolution.

questions.q: What is gradual implementation and why is it used in implementing a new network architecture?

a.option: It's the simultaneous installation of all network components.
It's the progressive migration of services and devices to the new network.
It's the manual configuration of each device on the network.
It's the testing and validation of the network before implementation.

questions.q: What is the main function of a firewall in a network?

a.option: Sharing files between devices.
Controlling the data traffic entering and leaving the network.
Storing data in the cloud.
Connecting devices to the internet.

questions.q: What types of firewalls exist and how do they differ from each other?

a.option: There are only software firewalls.
Packet-filtering firewalls only analyze IP addresses.
Next-generation firewalls are not necessary for small businesses.
All firewalls work the same way.

questions.q: What security measures can be taken to protect a WiFi network?

a.option: Using a complex and secure password.
Leaving the network open without a password.
Disabling the encryption of the network.
Sharing the password with all neighbors.

questions.q: What are the advantages and disadvantages of using a hidden SSID in a WiFi network?

a.option: A hidden SSID makes the network completely invisible.
A hidden SSID does not offer any security improvement.
A hidden SSID can make it difficult for some devices to connect to the network.
A hidden SSID is not compatible with all routers.

questions.q: What is a VPN and what benefits does it offer?

a.option: A VPN is a private network for file sharing.
A VPN hides your IP address and encrypts your data for added security.
A VPN only works on private networks.
A VPN is not compatible with mobile devices.

questions.q: What does the acronym 'DMZ' represent in the context of network security??

a.option: Direct Access Zone
Data Maintenance Zone
Demilitarized Zone
Maximum Zoning
